query: Let $f(x)$ be a function such that for all $x,$ $f(x) = f(x + 1) + f(x - 1).$  Given that $f(15) = 20$ and $f(20) = 15,$ compute $f(20152015).$
ground_truth:
Let $a = f(1)$ and $b = f(2).$  Then
\begin{align*}
f(3) &= f(2) - f(1) = b - a, \\
f(4) &= f(3) - f(2) = (b - a) - b = -a, \\
f(5) &= f(4) - f(3) = -a - (b - a) = -b, \\
f(6) &= f(5) - f(4) = -b - (-a) = a - b, \\
f(7) &= f(6) - f(5) = (a - b) - (-b) = a, \\
f(8) &= f(7) - f(6) = a - (a - b) = b.
\end{align*}Since $f(7) = f(1)$ and $f(8) = f(2),$ and each term depends only on the previous two terms, the function becomes periodic from here on, with a period of length 6.

Then $f(3) = f(15) = 20$ and $f(2) = f(20) = 15,$ and
\[f(20152015) = f(1) = f(2) - f(3) = 15 - 20 = \boxed{-5}.\]
